input: # Dot Home — Shopping List for Pilot Units (RTX 3060 standard) — v2

input:
Three configurations you can buy today. All will run Dot’s **Talents** fully **on‑device** with an **RTX 3060 12 GB**.  
This version replaces the **Power Train P40** with **Lian Li A3 mATX** (similar price once VAT/import is counted).

input: ## Option C — **Lian Li A3 mATX** (compact premium tower, replaces P40)
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input: **Why this option:** similar total cost to P40 once VAT/import is included, but with **better build quality, modular PSU mount (ATX/SFX), dust filters and documented airflow**. Still compact (≈26 L), but far easier to cool quietly than tiny ITX cubes.
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input: **Key case specs:** GPU up to **~415 mm** (varies with PSU placement); CPU cooler **≤ 165–167 mm**; supports **ATX/SFX/SFX‑L** PSUs; **no fans included**.

input: ## Common setup pack (all builds)
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input:
- [ ] **OS USB** — 16 GB USB drive (Windows 11 Pro or Ubuntu LTS)  
- [ ] **Ethernet cable** (recommended for first‑run)  
- [ ] **Peripherals for setup** — USB keyboard + monitor/HDMI/DP cable  
- [ ] **First‑run card** — Wi‑Fi, admin login, voice phrase: “*Install the Birdwatching talent kit*”
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input: ## Quick BIOS checklist
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input:
- [ ] Enable **EXPO** (DDR5‑6000) on AM5 / **XMP** or manual 3200/3600 on AM4  
- [ ] Set PEG slot to **Gen4** (Fractal Mood riser)  
- [ ] Enable **Resizable BAR**  
- [ ] Fan curves: Quiet profile; top/front fans ~35–40% until 60 °C
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input: ## Quiet‑tuning (optional)
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input:
- RTX 3060 power cap to **~170 W**  
  - Linux: `sudo nvidia-smi -pl 170`  
  - Windows: Afterburner → Power Limit **85–90%**, slight undervolt
output: I understand this information from Dot_Home_Shopping_List_A3_Revised.md. It contains relevant details.

input:
### Notes
- Swap any brand for an equivalent **that matches the dimensions and power limits** above.  
- For the Mood case, stick to **true 2‑slot** or **~2.2‑slot** RTX 3060 cards to maintain airflow.
